newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Woodside says shows in offshore well.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Woodside says shows in offshore well.

text.p: Woodside Petroleum Ltd said on Tuesday that the Keast-1 exploration well offshore Western Australia appeared to have intersected a gross hydrocarbon column of about 34 metres.
Woodside, the operator in permit WA-6L, said one core had been cut from the well.

"Preliminary examination of core supplemented by hydrocarbon indications and formation measurements taken while drilling indicates that a gross hydrocarbon column of approximately 34 metres has been intersected," it said.
Woodside said the well was at a depth of 3,019 metres in 8-1/2 inch hole on Tuesday and that operations had been suspended due to tropical cyclone Phil.
Further evaluation of the well will occur upon resumption of drilling, when the cyclone is no longer a potential danger to operations, it said.
WA-6-L is on Australia's North West Shelf.

Equal partners in the North West Shelf project are units of The Broken Hill Pty Co Ltd, The British Petroleum Co Plc, Japan Australia LNG (MiMi) Pty Ltd, a partnership of Mitsui & Co Ltd and Mitsubishi Corp, Chevron Corp, Royal Dutch/Shell Group and Woodside.
